result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel S Becker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, balance to be returned to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. Inform Agent of a prescriptions.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No violent contact with Sharilyn B.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
9 MONTHS DAY REPORT CENTER consecutive to condition time.

timeConds.notes: Non working hours, release for work and treatment, the last month STAYED; to be used a Agent's discretion.  53 days credit applied.  Sentence to begin forthwith.

Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests an adjournment and that the Defendant be granted Huber Bailee Status.  The State objects to the request for Huber Bailee Status.  The Court adjourns the hearing and denies the request for huber bailee status and bail remains as set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
